subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Revelation in the Cave
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Revelation in the Cave usable.

hook.text: A merchant retreated to a cave to think. An angel appeared and commanded: 'Read.' He couldn't read. Islam began.

buildup.text: Muhammad was 40, troubled by Mecca's corruption. In the Cave of Hira, the angel Gabriel delivered God's first words.

discovery.text: The first revelation became Surah 96: 'Read in the name of your Lord who created.' Islam's first command was to learn.

twist.text: Muhammad was terrified, not triumphant. He thought he was possessed. His wife Khadijah convinced him it was divine.

climax.text: A scared man in a cave became the prophet of 1.8 billion people. The greatest stories begin with doubt, not certainty.

punchline.text: Islam's first word was 'Read.' The faith began with a command to learn.

quiz.question: What was the first command given to Muhammad?
